content: simple comfort shawl copyright 2025 by amanda newlin of bean blossom fibers this is a purposely simple easy-to-memorize pattern that can be knit without having to think because sometimes you just need to knit something simple and comforting this is a stockinette shawl that will curl just a little bit in a jaunty fashion i often wear mine as a fashionable scarf and tie it in a loose knot for style this is written for fingering weight yarn but feel free to substitute any weight of yarn as long as you go up two or three sizes from your yarn s recommended needle size to keep your simple comfort shawl drapey skill level beginner yarn and needles used *fingering sock yarn 100g skein approx 460 yards sample knit with hoosier twist sock yarn roadside day lily from claypurl com *size 4 circular needles 24 or longer *locking stitch marker optional to mark the front of the shawl and regular stitch marker optional to mark beginning of row *tapestry needle gauge guage was 20 sts = 4 but gauge is not important so long as your fabric is drapey finished size sizes will vary depending on your yardage and weight of your yarn sample was a triangle 73 top long edge 53 side edge 30 cast off edge stitches used and abbreviations k = knit stitch p = purl stitch kfb = knit front and back k2tog = knit 2 together bind off let s begin set up section cast on 3 stitches using long tail cast on row 1 wrong side k2 kfb row 2 right side kfb k1 k2tog row 3 k to last stitch kfb 1 row 4 kfb k to last 2 stitches k2tog row 5 k to last stitch kfb repeat row 4 and 5 until 10 stitches are on the needle having just completed row 5 optional attach the locking stitch marker to the right side front of your fabric to help you keep track of the front side of your shawl and use a regular stitch marker to mark the beginning of row main body of shawl this section will create a garter stitch border on both the left and right sides of the shawl this is decorative and will help so that the edge won t curl quite so much though this shawl is made to curl some as part of the design row 1 right side kfb k to last 2 stitches k2tog row 2 wrong side k5 purl to last 4 stitches k3 kfb repeat these two row until you have approximately 10 to 15g of yarn left ending with row 2 you will need this last bit of yarn for a garter stitch border final section 10-15g yarn required row 1 right side kfb k to last 2 stitches k2tog row 2 wrong side knit all the stitches to last stitch kfb repeat these two row 4 more times 10 row total bind off loosely and weave in your ends
